org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit

Class UTF8UtilTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit.UTF8UtilTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class UTF8UtilTest
extends BaseTestCase
    Tests that skipFully and skipUntilEOF behaves correctly on Derby's modfied UTF-8 encoded streams.

    These tests are dependent on the behavior of ReaderToUTF8Stream. Note that this class inserts two bytes at the start of the user/application stream to encode the length of the stream. These two bytes may be zero, even if the stream is short enough for its length to be encoded.

    Also note that the lengths chosen for large streams are just suitably large integers. The point is to choose them large enough to make sure buffer boundaries are crossed.

    See Also:
    ReaderToUTF8Stream, UTF8Util

        public void testEqualityOfModifedUTF8AndASCII()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Ensure the assumption that the default looping alphabet stream and the modified UTF-8 encoding is equal.

        If this assumption is broken, several of the other tests will fail.

        java.io.IOException

      • testMissingSecondByteOfTwo

        public void testMissingSecondByteOfTwo()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to skip characters where the data is incomplete.

        In this test, the encoding states there is a character represented by two bytes present. However, only one byte is provided.

        java.io.IOException
